meanings.sent1: The ducklings followed their mother to the pond.

meanings.definition: A suffix used to form nouns indicating a person or thing belonging to a particular group or class.
meanings.sent1: The siblings were all members of the same family lings.
meanings.sent2: In the story, the villain was part of the pirate lings.
meanings.sent3: The superhero saved the day, protecting the city lings.
meanings.sent4: The team worked together as a well-oiled machine, a true example of work lings.
meanings.sent5: The club welcomed new members into their social lings.

meanings.definition: A suffix used to form adjectives indicating a relationship or resemblance.
meanings.sent1: The painting had a dreamy, ethereal lings to it.
meanings.sent2: The garden was filled with colorful flower lings.
meanings.sent3: The cake had a delicious chocolatey lings.
meanings.sent4: The music had a soothing, calming lings that relaxed everyone.
